snippet: Women who travel for work to countries like Saudi Arabia that place strict limits on their social and physical mobility have to prepare to compromise.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column observes as more women travel on business in Saudi Arabia, more of them are finding ways to work around traditional cultural system that presents hurdles for women; social pressure is building from Saudi women themselves, who comprise 20 percent of country's work force, up from 16 percent decade ago.
lead_paragraph: Women who travel for work to countries like Saudi Arabia that place strict limits on their social and physical mobility have to prepare to compromise.

headline.print_headline: Businesswomen Navigate Traditions in Saudi Arabia
headline.main: Businesswomen Navigate Traditions in Saudi Arabia
